intro: Chamartemisia, commonly known as the wormwood plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its aromatic, often strongly scented leaves and small, yellow to brownish flowers. The plant is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Chamartemisia species are known for their medicinal properties and have been used in traditional medicine for various ailments. Some species are also used as ornamental plants due to their distinctive foliage and resilience.
